title: Service-Learning Design and Evaluation Competency Enhancement Program in Engineering

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: A teaching competency enhancement program for pre-service or in-service teachers. Developing service-learning model design capabilities that link engineering education with social problem-solving for current practitioners

learning_goals: Engineering design processes and instructional design principles are integrated when designing service-learning activities

In the service/customer interaction training course, learners write a weekly reflective journal for each of the three core competencies (communication, problem-solving, emotional regulation). At the month-end evaluation, they apply a rubric (clarity, specificity, improvement plan) and achieve a score of 4 or higher (out of 5) to measure learning outcomes.

At the end of the 6-month long-term course, learners quantitatively analyze competency improvement using a digital assessment tool (10 survey questions + 3-stage simulation) that measures empathy (4 or higher on a 5-point scale) and service design skills (80% or higher in real-case application evaluation).

resources: LMS Platform (Discussion Board, Assignment Submission System)
Digital portfolio templates supporting reflective practice

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
